intro: Gilia tenuituba f. utahensis, commonly known as the Utah gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polemoniaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, showy flowers. The flowers are typically pink to purple in color and bloom during the summer months. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or open habitats. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
